name: The Historic Powhatan Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We Love Williamsburg and visit several times a year. We have stayed at powhatan twice in the past year. Our first time was in October last year and we only stayed one night. Our room on that occasion was very nice. I think the room had be recently remodeled. The outside deck was ok but really could use some work.
reviews.title: NEEDS A LITTLE TLC

reviews.text: We booked again in March this year and are room certainly lacked luster. I think we were in a room that hasn't made it to the remodel yet. We stayed in a down stairs 1 bedroom with private hot tub. I think the tub was an original to the resort. The tub didn't have any shine and it the frame surrounding had quite a bit of wear. The chlorine was so strong it burned your eyes and limited the amount of time you could stay in.
reviews.title: Great place to be with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positive things the staff was very friendly, the room was clean and except for the time share pitch we had a peaceful stay. We were told by the timeshare sales that they were renovating and there are definitely signs of that.
reviews.title: Sales pitch

reviews.text: As far as the kitchen it was fully stocked with new small appliances and the refrigerator, stove and microwave were all in good shape.
reviews.title: Great place for the price!
Great Spring Break getaway
reviews.text: When they finish I would expect it will be the 5 star resort that it should be.
My family stayed here last September 2011 with my two month year old son (the reason why I am posting this so late) and we were very impressed with the our 2 Bdrm Deluxe Condo.
reviews.title: Just make sure to stay in the newly renovated condos.

reviews.text: I had a time share with Diamond and this was one of the location in Williamsburg I could stay at and I must admit after reading some of the reviews I was little nervous about booking my stayed there. I like VERY clean and comfortable accommodations no matter where I travel and Powhatan Resort achieved this and more. When booking, my agent made sure I stayed at the newly renovated condos and since I had my child two grandmas I needed a downstairs condo. We got exactly what we asked. The rooms were a nice size and clean; plenty room for 4 adults and one child.
reviews.title: Sales pitch and outdated
Never Again
reviews.text: Everyone was friendly and there was plenty to do for the whole family.
Powhatan is close by to many shopping centers and Bush Gardens. I will come back again. I only regret not taking pictures of the condo to show.
reviews.title: Ok place - dated

reviews.text: We came in may 2012 and were not impressed with the condo. To start, the condo was very outdated with brass fixtures, 19 inch box tvs, and one tile was loose in the bathroom. I read where some of the condos were nice with hot tubs and flat screen tvs, it must just depend on which one you get. However, the pool area was great with separate pools for adults and children, very relaxing if you are looking for peace and quiet. The staff was also friendly and there was a health club with racquetball rooms you could use for free. When we checked in they tried to get us to sit through a sales pitch for a timeshare. We were going to just sit through it at first to get discounted tickets to Williamsburg in return for listening to the sales pitch, but then they wanted us to put down a $20 deposit to reserve our sales pitch time and we told them we were not interested. They were a little pushy at that point which annoyed us but we never sat through it. I loved the pool area but given how dated the condo felt I would probably stay somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Awful hotel staff and service, room items stolen by housekeeping!!!!

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here. For the same price as a hotel you get a 2 bedroom condo which made it great to spread out with the kids! My daughter enjoyed the indoor pool but the water made her hair disgusting (maybe too many chemicals?). The condo was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. It would have been nice to have a t.v. in the second bedroom but overall, it had everything you could ask for! We liked the location - pretty close to the sights. There was also a really neat playground down the road for the kids.
reviews.title: A nice weekend!

reviews.text: Its seems this resort is somewhat of a time share thing. I went out of season, booking on hotels.com and got a whole condo to myself for very cheap ($70). However, i think they like to entice you in and when you go to check in, they try and get you to attend meetings, which i assume is for the hard selling of time share. I got out of it easy enough, so don't be detered too much on this basis. Otherwise its nice grounds and the condos are roomy. Not that close to Williamsburg center, but fine if have your own vehicle and is good for a bargain if you have a few people with you.
reviews.title: Nice condos and good price (if get the sale offer), but watch out for the hard sell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here using a Groupon deal that was $99 for 2 nights. Seemed like a good deal, so we jumped on it.
reviews.title: Good Deal for the Price

reviews.text: I saw lots of complaints from people saying that the staff pushed the Timeshare property, but I didn't feel any pressure. I got a call a week in advance asking if we were interested in more information, I said no...and we didn't hear another word about it. That was a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING

reviews.text: The condo was nice. (I'll upload pictures when I can). They had a full kitchen, living/dining area, large bathroom, walk-in closet, and a decent sized bedroom. There was a patio and...best of all...an enclosed room off the bedroom that had a large hot tub.
reviews.title: Lots of Love for Powhatan!

reviews.text: Made reservations at the Inn while traveling. What a super place. We got lucky because it was off-season rates but still enjoyed first rate accommodations. Beautiful townhouse with two bedrooms (traveling with our best friends) and a hot tub right in an attached separate room. Beds very comfortable and the fireplace in the front room was a very nice touch. Historic Jamestown settlement and Colonial Williamsburg are minutes away. Convenient drive to Norfolk and Richmond too. When we head back that way (and we will soon), we will re-book there.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in friday night was quick and efficient. Stayed in 2 bedroom 2nd floor unit. Units are large and clean. Some of the decks are being replaced. Wished they used trex instead of wood. We love the grounds, the mansion, and the restaurant on site.
reviews.title: 2 night stay

reviews.text: However I was very overwhelmingly surprised. The place was very clean and updated. The staff was excellent. The only reason I went against my gut feelings was that someone else coming down was staying here on the recommendation of their relative.
reviews.title: I had read the reviews and was nervous......

reviews.text: I would definetly stay here again and I would highly recommend it. We had a 2 bedroom condo and the place was very nice.
reviews.title: Nice family rental.

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights during spring break and had a wonderful time. The location was great, we were close to Busch Gardens, Colonial Williamsburg and only 45 minutes to Virginia Beach. Our room was nice but as others pointed out the TV's were old and small. However since we really didn't spend much time watching TV it really wasn't a big deal. I found the rooms to be nicely equipped with everything we needed. The only small issue we had was the noise from the room above us. If you don't want to listen to your neighbors jump around all night you might want to book the top floor.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go again!

description: A Little Piece of American HistoryVirginia is one of the best places to visit if you are a history buff and want to learn more about the birth of a nation and see relics from days gone by. Williamsburg is a 170-acre historic town that has been restored to its original English condition. The Historic Powhatan Resort offers guests a little piece of colonial history with the restored Manor House (circa 1735). Nestled among 256 acres of beautiful woodland, this resort is loaded with fun things to see and do, and learn a little bit of American history. Rest, Relaxation, and a Whole Lot MoreIf you are looking for a resort that has all kinds of things to do, then you need look no further than The Historic Powhatan Resort. Here you can enjoy both indoor and outdoor swimming pools, tennis courts, an outdoor pavilion, and even a playground for the kids. Each three-bedroom suite has a fully equipped kitchen with a two-burner stovetop, a private balcony and a loft for the ultimate in relaxing vacations.If you are looking for a great meal, you can find it at The Historic Powhatan Bar & Grille, where you will find a casual family dining atmosphere for both breakfast and dinner. Open seven days a week, The Historic Powhatan Bar &Grille has an outdoor patio where you can enjoy a nice, cold drink while watching the peaceful pond (weather permitting, of course). During the breakfast buffet, enjoy being entertained by the resort's very own "first lady", Martha Washington, who will regale guests of all ages with amusing and entertaining stories.Whether you are looking for rest and relaxation, or fun and excitement, you can have it all at The Historic Powhatan Resort.
